foreSonetMib.name: foreSonetMib
foreSonetMib.contactinfo: Postal: FORE Systems Inc. 1000 FORE Drive Warrendale, PA 15086-7502 Tel: +1 724 742 6900 Email: nm_mibs@fore.com Web: http://www.fore.com
foreSonetMib.description: This mib implements extensions to the standard SONET mib to support extra configuration and statistics that are supported by Fore Systems.

foreSonetMediumConfigTable.name: foreSonetMediumConfigTable
foreSonetMediumConfigTable.description: A table of configuration options and statistics that extend the Sonet Medium Group in the Standard SONET MIB.

foreSonetMediumConfigEntry.name: foreSonetMediumConfigEntry
foreSonetMediumConfigEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard SONET Medium Group Tables.

foreSonetMediumConfigLoopbackMode.name: foreSonetMediumConfigLoopbackMode
foreSonetMediumConfigLoopbackMode.description: This variable represents the current loopback status of the SONET interface. The possible values are: sonetNoLoop (1) means that the interface is not in a loopback state. sonetLineLoop (2) means that the receive data and clock are connected to the transmit data and clock. sonetDiagLoop (3) means that the transmit data stream and clock are looped back to the receiver. sonetOtherLoop (4) means that the interface is in a loopback that is not defined here.

foreSonetMediumConfigTxClockSource.name: foreSonetMediumConfigTxClockSource
foreSonetMediumConfigTxClockSource.description: The source of the transmit clock.

foreSonetSectionTotalTable.name: foreSonetSectionTotalTable
foreSonetSectionTotalTable.description: A table of configuration options and statistics that extend the standard Sonet section tables.

foreSonetSectionTotalEntry.name: foreSonetSectionTotalEntry
foreSonetSectionTotalEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard SONET section table statistics.

foreSonetSectionTotalBIPs.name: foreSonetSectionTotalBIPs
foreSonetSectionTotalBIPs.description: The number of Section BIP-8 (Bit Interleaved Parity) errors that have been detected since the last time the port has been reset. The calculated BIP-8 code is compared with the BIP-8 code extracted from the B1 byte of the following frame. Differences indicate that a section level bit error has occurred.

foreSonetSectionTotalLOSs.name: foreSonetSectionTotalLOSs
foreSonetSectionTotalLOSs.description: The number of seconds in which Loss Of Signal (LOS) has occurred. A LOS is declared when 20 +/- 3us of all zeros patterns is detected. LOS is cleared when two valid framing words are detected and during the intervening time no LOS condition is detected.

foreSonetSectionTotalLOFs.name: foreSonetSectionTotalLOFs
foreSonetSectionTotalLOFs.description: The number of seconds in which Loss Of Frame (LOF) has occurred. A LOF is declared when an out-of-frame (OOF) condition persists for 3ms. The LOF is cleared when an in-frame condition persists for 3ms. While in-frame the framing bytes (A1, A2) in each frame are compared against the expected pattern. Out-of-frame is declared when four consecutive frames containing one or more framing pattern errors have been received.

foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsTable.name: foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsTable
foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsTable.description: A table of configuration options and statistics that extend the standard Sonet Section tables.

foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsEntry.name: foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsEntry
foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard SONET Section tables.

foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsFraming.name: foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsFraming
foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsFraming.description: Controls the insertion of framing (A1 A2 byte) errors. off When set to off, transmit Sonet frames continously with no A1A2 errors (framing errors). on When set to on, transmit Sonet frames continously with bad A1A2 values. momentary When set to momentary, transmit a chip dependent number of Sonet frames with A1A2 errors.

foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsB1.name: foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsB1
foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsB1.description: Controls the insertion of BIP errors in the sonet section B1 byte overhead. off When set to off, do not generate section BIP errors. on When set to on, generate section BIP errors. momentary When set to momentary, transmit a chip dependent number of Sonet frames with section BIP errors.

foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsDisableTxScra.name: foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsDisableTxScrambling
foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsDisableTxScra.description: Controls the scrambling of sonet overhead and SPE of the transmitted Sonet frame. off When set to off, transmitted Sonet frames are scrambled. on When set to on, transmitted Sonet frames are NOT scrambled.

foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsDisableRxDesc.name: foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsDisableRxDescrambling
foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsDisableRxDesc.description: Controls the descrambling of sonet overhead and SPE of the received Sonet frame. off When set to off, received Sonet frames are descrambled. on When set to on, received Sonet frames are NOT descrambled.

foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsLOS.name: foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsLOS
foreSonetSectionDiagnosticsLOS.description: Controls the insertion of Loss of Signal (LOS) errors in the transmitted Sonet frame. off When set to off, do not generate LOS errors. on When set to on, generate LOS errors.

foreSonetSectionCurrentTable.name: foreSonetSectionCurrentTable
foreSonetSectionCurrentTable.description: The Fore's extension to SONET/SDH Section Current table.

foreSonetSectionCurrentEntry.name: foreSonetSectionCurrentEntry
foreSonetSectionCurrentEntry.description: An entry in the SONET/SDH Section Current table.

foreSonetSectionCurrentBBEs.name: foreSonetSectionCurrentBBEs
foreSonetSectionCurrentBBEs.description: The counter associated with the number of Background Errors encountered by a SONET/SDH Section in the current 15 minute interval.

foreSonetSectionIntervalTable.name: foreSonetSectionIntervalTable
foreSonetSectionIntervalTable.description: The Fore's extension to SONET/SDH Section Interval table.

foreSonetSectionIntervalEntry.name: foreSonetSectionIntervalEntry
foreSonetSectionIntervalEntry.description: An entry in the SONET/SDH Section Interval table.

foreSonetSectionIntervalBBEs.name: foreSonetSectionIntervalBBEs
foreSonetSectionIntervalBBEs.description: The counter associated with the number of Background Errors encountered by a SONET/SDH Section in a particular 15-minute interval in the past 24 hours.

foreSonetSectionIntervalESR.name: foreSonetSectionIntervalESR
foreSonetSectionIntervalESR.description: The ratio of Errored seconds encountered by a SONET/SDH Section to time in a particular 15-minute interval in the past 24 hours.

foreSonetSectionIntervalSESR.name: foreSonetSectionIntervalSESR
foreSonetSectionIntervalSESR.description: The ratio of Sev Errored seconds encountered by a SONET/SDH Section to time in a particular 15-minute interval in the past 24 hours.

foreSonetSectionIntervalBBER.name: foreSonetSectionIntervalBBER
foreSonetSectionIntervalBBER.description: The ratio of Background blk errors encountered by a SONET/SDH Section to time in a particular 15-minute interval in the past 24 hours.

foreSonetLineCurrentTable.name: foreSonetLineCurrentTable
foreSonetLineCurrentTable.description: The Fore's extension to SONET/SDH Line Current table.

foreSonetLineCurrentEntry.name: foreSonetLineCurrentEntry
foreSonetLineCurrentEntry.description: An entry in the SONET/SDH Line Current table.

foreSonetLineCurrentBBEs.name: foreSonetLineCurrentBBEs

foreSonetLineIntervalTable.name: foreSonetLineIntervalTable

foreSonetLineIntervalEntry.name: foreSonetLineIntervalEntry

foreSonetLineIntervalBBEs.name: foreSonetLineIntervalBBEs
foreSonetLineIntervalBBEs.description: The counter associated with the number of Background Errors encountered by a SONET/SDH Line in a particular 15-minute interval in the past 24 hours.

foreSonetLineIntervalESR.name: foreSonetLineIntervalESR
foreSonetLineIntervalESR.description: The ratio of Errored seconds encountered by a SONET/SDH Line to time in a particular 15-minute interval in the past 24 hours.

foreSonetLineIntervalSESR.description: The ratio of Sev Errored seconds encountered by a SONET/SDH Line to time in a particular 15-minute interval in the past 24 hours.

foreSonetLineIntervalBBER.description: The ratio of Background blk errors encountered by a SONET/SDH Line to time in a particular 15-minute interval in the past 24 hours.

foreSonetFarEndLineCurrentEntry.name: foreSonetFarEndLineCurrentEntry

foreSonetFarEndLineIntervalEntry.name: foreSonetFarEndLineIntervalEntry
foreSonetFarEndLineIntervalEntry.description: An entry in the SONET/SDH FarEndLine Interval table.

foreSonetFarEndLineIntervalBBEs.name: foreSonetFarEndLineIntervalBBEs
foreSonetFarEndLineIntervalBBEs.description: The counter associated with the number of Background Errors encountered by a SONET/SDH FarEndLine in a particular 15-minute interval in the past 24 hours.

foreSonetPathIntervalEntry.name: foreSonetPathIntervalEntry

foreSonetPathIntervalBBEs.name: foreSonetPathIntervalBBEs

foreSonetPathIntervalESR.name: foreSonetPathIntervalESR

foreSonetPathIntervalSESR.name: foreSonetPathIntervalSESR

foreSonetLineConfigTable.name: foreSonetLineConfigTable
foreSonetLineConfigTable.description: A table of configuration options and statistics that extend the Sonet Line Group in the Standard SONET MIB.

foreSonetLineConfigEntry.name: foreSonetLineConfigEntry
foreSonetLineConfigEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard SONET Line Group Tables.

foreSonetLineBipThrSeconds.name: foreSonetLineBipThrSeconds
foreSonetLineBipThrSeconds.description: This variable represents the consecutive number of BAD/GOOD seconds to detect/clear a B2 byte Line Bit Interleaved Parity (BIP) Defect. The range of the values it can take is between 2 and 10 inclusive.

foreSonetLineBipThrErrors.name: foreSonetLineBipThrErrors
foreSonetLineBipThrErrors.description: This variable is a threshold for the number of B2 byte Line Bit Interleaved Parity (BIP) Errors per second and is used as a parameter to the Line BIP Defect. If the number of errors exceeds the threshold, the particular second is declared BAD, otherwise it is declared GOOD.

foreSonetLineBipFailEnable.name: foreSonetLineBipFailEnable
foreSonetLineBipFailEnable.description: This variable controls whether declaration of a Line BIP Defect forces the port's operState to Down.

foreSonetLineSignalDegradeBer.name: foreSonetLineSignalDegradeBer
foreSonetLineSignalDegradeBer.description: This is the exponent of 10 for the current signal degrade bit error rate (BER) threshold for this port. The value -7, for example, represents a BER of 1E-7. This variable is only applicable when sonetLineBerErrorModel is set to errorModelRandom.

foreSonetLineSignalFailBer.name: foreSonetLineSignalFailBer
foreSonetLineSignalFailBer.description: This is the exponent of 10 for the current signal fail bit error rate (BER) threshold for this port. The value -4, for example, represents a BER of 1E-4. This variable is only applicable when sonetLineBerErrorModel is set to errorModelRandom.

foreSonetLineBerErrorModel.name: foreSonetLineBerErrorModel
foreSonetLineBerErrorModel.description: This is the error distribution model to be used to identify signal degrade and signal fail conditions. errorModelRandom selects a random error distribution and declares signal conditions based on the thresholds set in sonetLineSignalDegradeBer and sonetLineSignalFailBer. errorModelBurst selects a burst error model and declares signal degrade conditions based on the thresholds set in sonetLineBipThrSeconds and sonetLineBipThrErrors. errorModelNone disables detection of signal conditions.

foreSonetLineBerState.name: foreSonetLineBerState
foreSonetLineBerState.description: This value describes the current state of the port as determined through bit error rate analysis.

foreSonetLineTotalTable.name: foreSonetLineTotalTable
foreSonetLineTotalTable.description: A table of configuration options and statistics that extend the Sonet Line Group in the Standard SONET MIB.

foreSonetLineTotalEntry.name: foreSonetLineTotalEntry
foreSonetLineTotalEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard SONET Line Group Tables.

foreSonetLineTotalBIPs.name: foreSonetLineTotalBIPs
foreSonetLineTotalBIPs.description: The number of Line BIP-24 (Bit Interleaved Parity) errors that have been detected since the last time the port has been reset. The calculated BIP-24 code is based on the line overhead and synchronous payload envelope (SPE) of the STS-3c stream. The line BIP-24 code is a bit interleaved parity calculation using even parity. The calculated code is compared with the BIP-24 code extracted from the B2 bytes of the following frame. Differences indicate that a line layer bit error has occurred.

foreSonetLineTotalFEBEs.name: foreSonetLineTotalFEBEs
foreSonetLineTotalFEBEs.description: The number of line Far End Block Errors (FEBE) that have been detected since the last time the port has been reset.

foreSonetLineTotalAISs.name: foreSonetLineTotalAISs
foreSonetLineTotalAISs.description: The number of seconds in which line Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) has occurred. A line AIS is asserted when a 111 binary pattern is detected in bits 6,7,8 of the K2 byte for five consecutive frames. A line AIS is removed when any pattern other than 111 is detected in these bits for five consecutive frames.

foreSonetLineTotalRDIs.name: foreSonetLineTotalRDIs
foreSonetLineTotalRDIs.description: The number of seconds in which line Far End Receive Failure (RDI) has occurred. A line RDI is asserted when a 110 binary pattern is detected in bits 6,7,8 of the K2 byte for five consecutive frames. A line RDI is removed when any pattern other than 110 is detected in these bits for five consecutive frames.

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsTable.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsTable
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsTable.description: A table of configuration options and statistics that extend the Sonet Line Group in the Standard SONET MIB.

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsEntry.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsEntry
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard SONET Line Group Tables.

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsLAIS.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsLAIS
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsLAIS.description: Controls the insertion of line alarm indication signal (AIS_L). on When set to on, all bits of the SONET frame are set to 1 except for the section overhead. off resume normal operation

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsB2.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsB2
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsB2.description: Controls the insertion of BIP errors in the sonet line B2 byte overhead. off When set to off, do not generate line BIP errors. on When set to on, generate line BIP errors. momentary When set to momentary, transmit a chip dependent number of Sonet frame with line BIP errors.

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsAPS.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsAPS
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsAPS.description: Controls the insertion of line APS bytes (K1 and K2) that are determined by normal operating rules or by diagnostic mibs. off When set to off, resume normal operation. on When set to on, K1 and K2 bytes are calculated by contents of diagnostic mibs.

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK1channel.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK1channel
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK1channel.description: Specifies the channel number code, k1 bits 5 to 8. * null(0) - null channel Code 0 is used with the Lockout of Protection request. * working(1..14) - Working channels Codes 1 through n apply in a 1:n architecture Only code 1 applies in a 1+1 architecture *extraTraffic(15) - Extra traffic channel May exist only when provisioned in a 1:n architecture NOTE: Refer to GR-253-CORE for more details

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK1request.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK1request
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK1request.description: Defines the various values for K1 byte (1-4) for the type of request For 1+1 systems, Forced and Manual switch request apply. SD and SF requests apply to conditions detected on the protection line.

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK2channel.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK2channel
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK2channel.description: Specifies the channel number code, k2 bits 1 to 4 * null - null channel Code 0 is used with the Lockout of Protection request. * working(1..14) - Working channels Codes 1 through n apply in a 1:n architecture Only code1 applies in a 1+1 architecture * extraTraffic(15) - Extra traffic channel May exist only when provisioned in a 1:n architecture NOTE: Refer to GR-253-CORE for more details

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK2Architecture.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK2Architecture
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK2Architecture.description: Bit 5 of the K2 byte shall be set to indicate: Code '0' if the provisioned (or only supported) architecture is 1+1 Code '1' if the provisioned (or only supported) architecture is 1:n

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK2Mode.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK2Mode
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsK2Mode.description: Bits 6 through 8 of the K2 byte shall be set to indicate: Code '101' if the provisioned mode is bidirectional Code '100' if the provisioned mode is unidirectional The codes '011', '010', '001' and '000' in K2 bites 6-8 are reserved for future use in 1:n drop and insert(nested) protection switching, and the code '111' is used in detecting an incoming AIS_L.

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsLRDI.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsLRDI
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsLRDI.description: Controls the insertion of line Remote Defect Indication (Line RDI). Line RDI is inserted by transmitting the code 110 (binary) in bit positions 6, 7 and 8 of the K2 byte contained in the transmit stream. off When set to off, Line RDI is NOT inserted in the transmit stream even if LOS/LOF is received on When set to on, Line RDI is inserted continuously in the transmit stream. auto When set to auto, Line RDI is inserted as under normal operation

foreSonetLineDiagnosticsLREI.name: foreSonetLineDiagnosticsLREI
foreSonetLineDiagnosticsLREI.description: Controls the insertion of Line Remote Error Indication (REI_L). The number of BIP errors (B2) detected are encoded in the transmit REI_L (M0/M1) byte. REI_L was previously called Line FEBE (Far End Block Error). off When set to off, insert 0 for M0/M1 bytes, irrespective of the number of B2 errors received. on When set to on, insert 8/8N for M0/M1 bytes continuously. auto When set to auto, resume normal operation.

foreSonetPathConfigTable.name: foreSonetPathConfigTable
foreSonetPathConfigTable.description: A table of configuration options and statistics that extend the standard SONET Path Tables

foreSonetPathConfigEntry.name: foreSonetPathConfigEntry
foreSonetPathConfigEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard SONET path tables

foreSonetPathRxSignalLabel.name: foreSonetPathRxSignalLabel
foreSonetPathRxSignalLabel.description: This variable contains the path signal label byte (C2). The value in this variable is updated to a new path signal label value if the same new value is observed for two consecutive frames.

foreSonetPathTxSignalLabel.name: foreSonetPathTxSignalLabel
foreSonetPathTxSignalLabel.description: This variable controls the transmit path payload. The default value for ATM is 0x13 (19 decimal). Changing the value of this variable attempts to change the payload and if successfull will change the transmitted C2 label to reflect the new payload. Use the C2 variable in the diagnostics table if you wish to change the C2 value for diagnostic purposes without actually changing the transmitted payload type.

foreSonetPathLoopbackMode.name: foreSonetPathLoopbackMode
foreSonetPathLoopbackMode.description: This variable represents the current loopback status of the SONET interface. The possible values are: sonetPathNoLoop (1) means that the interface is not in a loopback state. sonetPathLineLoop (2) means that the receive data is connected to the transmit data. sonetPathDiagLoop (3) means that the transmit data stream is looped back to the receiver. sonetPathOtherLoop (4) means that the interface is in a loopback that is not defined here.

foreSonetPathTotalTable.name: foreSonetPathTotalTable
foreSonetPathTotalTable.description: A table of configuration options and statistics that extend the standard SONET Path Tables

foreSonetPathTotalEntry.name: foreSonetPathTotalEntry
foreSonetPathTotalEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard SONET path tables

foreSonetPathTotalBIPs.name: foreSonetPathTotalBIPs
foreSonetPathTotalBIPs.description: The number of Path BIP-8 (Bit Interleaved Parity) errors that have been detected since the last time the port has been reset. A path BIP-8 error is detected by comparing the path BIP-8 byte (B3) extracted from the current frame, to the path BIP-8 computed for the previous frame.

foreSonetPathTotalLOPs.name: foreSonetPathTotalLOPs
foreSonetPathTotalLOPs.description: The number of seconds in which path Loss Of Pointer (LOP) has occurred. A path LOP is detected when a 'normal pointer value' is not found in eight consecutive frames. The LOP is cleared when a 'normal pointer value' is detected for three consecutive frames.

foreSonetPathTotalAISs.name: foreSonetPathTotalAISs
foreSonetPathTotalAISs.description: The number of seconds in which path Alarm Indication Signal (AIS) has occurred. A path AIS is asserted when an all-ones pattern is detected in the pointer bytes (H1 and H2) for three consecutive frames. It is cleared when a valid pointer is detected for three consecutive frames. AIS indicates that an upstream failure has been detected.

foreSonetPathTotalRDIs.name: foreSonetPathTotalRDIs
foreSonetPathTotalRDIs.description: The number of seconds in which path RDI alarm has occurred. A path RDI alarm is detected by extracting bit 5 of the path status byte. If bit 5 is high for ten consecutive frames, a RDI alarm is declared. A RDI alarm is cleared when bit 5 is low for ten consecutive frames. RDI signals are used to alert upstream terminals of a downstream failure in order to initiate trunk conditioning on the failure circuit.

foreSonetPathTotalUNEQs.name: foreSonetPathTotalUNEQs
foreSonetPathTotalUNEQs.description: The number of seconds in which a path UNEQ defect has occurred. A path UNEQ defect is detected when the STS Signal label (C2 byte) == 0x00

foreSonetPathTotalPLMs.name: foreSonetPathTotalPLMs
foreSonetPathTotalPLMs.description: The number of seconds in which a path PLM defect has occrred. A path PLM defect is detected when the STS Signal lable (C2 bytes) != 0x00, 0x01, 0x13, 0xFC or 0xFF.

foreSonetPathTotalFEBEs.name: foreSonetPathTotalFEBEs
foreSonetPathTotalFEBEs.description: The number of path Far End Block Errors (FEBE) that have been detected since the last time the port has been reset. FEBEs are detected by extracting the 4-bit FEBE field from the path status byte (G1). The legal range for the 4 bit field is between 0000 and 1000, representing zero to eight errors. Any other value is interpreted as zero errors.

foreSonetPathCurrentTable.name: foreSonetPathCurrentTable
foreSonetPathCurrentTable.description: A table of configuration options and statistics that extend the standard SONET Path table.

foreSonetPathCurrentEntry.name: foreSonetPathCurrentEntry
foreSonetPathCurrentEntry.description: A table entry containing fore specific extensions to the current status table for SONET paths.

foreSonetPathCurrentStatus.name: foreSonetPathCurrentStatus
foreSonetPathCurrentStatus.description: This variable indicates information about the current status of the sonet path. This variable is encoded as a bit vector so it can represent multiple conditions simultaneously. The various bit positions are: 1 pathPDI-P detected pathPDI-P is set when the incoming path C2 byte is set to a value in the range 0xe1..0xfc.

foreSonetPathCurrentBBEs.name: foreSonetPathCurrentBBEs
foreSonetPathCurrentBBEs.description: The counter associated with the number of Background Errors encountered by a SONET/SDH Path in the current 15 minute interval.

foreSonetPathDiagnosticsTable.name: foreSonetPathDiagnosticsTable
foreSonetPathDiagnosticsTable.description: A table of diagnostics tests that extend the standard SONET Path Tables

foreSonetPathDiagnosticsEntry.name: foreSonetPathDiagnosticsEntry
foreSonetPathDiagnosticsEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard SONET path tables

foreSonetPathDiagnosticsC2.name: foreSonetPathDiagnosticsC2
foreSonetPathDiagnosticsC2.description: Controls the insertion of Signal label/Payload Defect Indication (PDI_P) into the C2 byte of the Sonet path overhead. The various values for Signal label/PDI_P are defined in GR-253-CORE. off When set to off, the C2 byte is set to previously configured C2 value. on When set to on, the foreSonetPathDiagnosticsC2Value is inserted in the C2 byte of the tranmsit stream.

foreSonetPathDiagnosticsC2Value.name: foreSonetPathDiagnosticsC2Value
foreSonetPathDiagnosticsC2Value.description: Contains C2 byte value of the transmit stream

foreSonetPathDiagnosticsB3.name: foreSonetPathDiagnosticsB3
foreSonetPathDiagnosticsB3.description: Controls the insertion of Path BIP errors in the sonet path B3 byte overhead. off When set to off, do not generate path BIP errors. on When set to on, generate path BIP errors. momentary When set to momentary, transmit a chip dependent number of Sonet frames with path BIP errors.

foreSonetPathDiagnosticsPREI.name: foreSonetPathDiagnosticsPREI
foreSonetPathDiagnosticsPREI.description: Controls the insertion of Sonet Path Remote Error Indication (REI_P) (previously called Far End Block Error (FEBE)). G1 byte 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 ----|----|----|----|----|----|----|----| | REI_P | RDI_P | uu | ---------------------------------------- REI_P Path Remote Error Indication RDI_P Path Remote Defect Indication uu Unused off When set to off, the value 0 is inserted in bits 1:4 of G1 byte. on When set to on, the value 0x8 is inserted in bits 1:4 of G1 byte. auto When set to auto, resume normal operation.

foreSonetPathDiagnosticsPAIS.name: foreSonetPathDiagnosticsPAIS
foreSonetPathDiagnosticsPAIS.description: Controls the insertion of STS Path Alarm Indication Signal (AIS_P). off When set to off, AIS_P is not generated under any circumstances. on When set to on, AIS_P is generated.

foreSonetPathDiagnosticsPERDI.name: foreSonetPathDiagnosticsPERDI
foreSonetPathDiagnosticsPERDI.description: Controls the insertion of Enhanced Remote Defect Indication. Bits 5,6, and 7 of G1 byte is used for the inserting ERDI. G1 byte 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 ----|----|----|----|----|----|----|----| | REI_P | RDI_P | uu | ---------------------------------------- REI_P Path Remote Error Indication RDI_P Path Remote Defect Indication uu Unused on When set to on, foreSonetPathDiagnosticsERDIValue is inserted in the bits 5,6,7 of G1 byte. auto When set to auto, resume normal operation using single bit RDI.

foreSonetPathDiagnosticsERDIValue.name: foreSonetPathDiagnosticsERDIValue
foreSonetPathDiagnosticsERDIValue.description: Defines the values that may be inserted in the bits 5,6 and 7 of G1 byte. 1xx - One bit RDI 000 - No RDI_P defect with no priority 001 - No RDI_P defect 010 - ERDI_P payload defect 101 - ERDI_P server defect 110 - ERDI_P connectivity defect

foreSonetPathDiagnosticsLOP.name: foreSonetPathDiagnosticsLOP
foreSonetPathDiagnosticsLOP.description: Controls the insertion of Loss of pointer for path level. off When set to off, loss of pointer is not generated. on When set to on, loss of pointer is generated in the transmit direction.

foreSonetPathGroupConfigTable.name: foreSonetPathGroupConfigTable
foreSonetPathGroupConfigTable.description: A table of configuration options for Sonet Path VT Groups that extend the standard SONET Path tables.

foreSonetPathGroupConfigEntry.name: foreSonetPathGroupConfigEntry
foreSonetPathGroupConfigEntry.description: A table entry containing Marconi specific extensions to the SONET Path configuration table.

foreVTGroup.name: foreVTGroup
foreVTGroup.description: This variable indicates the sonet VT group number within the sonet path. It can range from 0 to 6.

foreVTWidth.name: foreVTWidth
foreVTWidth.description: This variable indicates the sonet VT width.

foreSonetVTConfigTable.name: foreSonetVTConfigTable
foreSonetVTConfigTable.description: A table of sonet VT configuration options that extend the standard sonet VT tables

foreSonetVTConfigEntry.name: foreSonetVTConfigEntry
foreSonetVTConfigEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard sonet VT tables

foreSonetVTLoopbackMode.name: foreSonetVTLoopbackMode
foreSonetVTLoopbackMode.description: This variable represents the current loopback status of the sonet interface. The possible values are: sonetVTNoLoop(1): interface is not in a loopback state. sonetVTLineLoop(2): data on the receive path is looped back on to the transmit path. sonetVTDiagLoop(3): data to be transmitted on the transmit path is looped back on to the receive path. sonetVTOtherLoop(4): the loopback mode is not defined here.

foreSonetVTTotalTable.name: foreSonetVTTotalTable
foreSonetVTTotalTable.description: A table of statistics that extend the standard sonet VT Tables

foreSonetVTTotalEntry.name: foreSonetVTTotalEntry
foreSonetVTTotalEntry.description: A table entry containing Fore specific extensions to the standard sonet VT tables

foreSonetVTTotalBIPs.name: foreSonetVTTotalBIPs
foreSonetVTTotalBIPs.description: The number of VT BIP-2 errors that have been detected since the last time this interface has been reset.

foreSonetVTTotalREIs.name: foreSonetVTTotalREIs
foreSonetVTTotalREIs.description: The number of REIs that have been detected since the last time this interface has been reset.

foreSonetVTTotalLOPs.name: foreSonetVTTotalLOPs
foreSonetVTTotalLOPs.description: The number of seconds in which VT LOP has occurred since the last time this interface has been reset.

foreSonetVTTotalAISs.name: foreSonetVTTotalAISs
foreSonetVTTotalAISs.description: The number of seconds in which VT AIS has occurred since the last time this interface has been reset.

foreSonetVTTotalRDIs.name: foreSonetVTTotalRDIs
foreSonetVTTotalRDIs.description: The number of seconds in which VT RDI has occurred since the last time this interface has been reset.

foreSonetVTTotalUNEQs.name: foreSonetVTTotalUNEQs
foreSonetVTTotalUNEQs.description: The number of seconds in which VT UNEQ has occurred since the last time this interface has been reset.

foreSonetVTTotalPLMs.name: foreSonetVTTotalPLMs
foreSonetVTTotalPLMs.description: The number of seconds in which VT PLM has occrred since the last time this interface has been reset.

foreSonetVTDiagnosticsTable.name: foreSonetVTDiagnosticsTable
foreSonetVTDiagnosticsTable.description: A table of diagnostic controls that are used to manipulate Sonet virtual tributaries.

foreSonetVTDiagnosticsEntry.name: foreSonetVTDiagnosticsEntry
foreSonetVTDiagnosticsEntry.description: A table entry containing Marconi specific extensions to the standard Sonet VT Tables.

foreSonetVtDiagnosticsBIP.name: foreSonetVtDiagnosticsBIP
foreSonetVtDiagnosticsBIP.description: Controls the insertion of VT BIP errors in the sonet VT V5 byte overhead. on: Generate sonet VT BIP errors continuously. off: Do not generate sonet VT BIP errors. momentary: Generate a chip dependent number of sonet frames with sonet VT BIP errors.

foreSonetVtDiagnosticsRDI.name: foreSonetVtDiagnosticsRDI
foreSonetVtDiagnosticsRDI.description: Controls the generation of VT RDI defects on the selected interface. Value Description on(1) RDI is continually tramsmitted off(2) RDI is never transmitted momentary(3) RDI is transmitted for a short period of time. auto(4) RDI is generated according to the sonet specification

foreSonetVtDiagnosticsRFI.name: foreSonetVtDiagnosticsRFI
foreSonetVtDiagnosticsRFI.description: Controls the generation of VT RFI defects on the selected interface. Value Description on(1) RFI is continually tramsmitted off(2) RFI is never transmitted momentary(3) RFI is transmitted for a short period of time. auto(4) RFI is generated according to the sonet specification

foreSonetVtDiagnosticsAIS.name: foreSonetVtDiagnosticsAIS
foreSonetVtDiagnosticsAIS.description: Controls the generation of VT AIS on the selected interface. Value Description on(1) AIS is continually tramsmitted off(2) AIS is never transmitted momentary(3) AIS is transmitted for a short period of time. auto(4) AIS is generated according to the sonet specification

foreSonetVtDiagnosticsLOP.name: foreSonetVtDiagnosticsLOP
foreSonetVtDiagnosticsLOP.description: Controls the generation of VT LOP on the selected interface. Value Description on(1) LOP is continually tramsmitted off(2) LOP is never transmitted momentary(3) LOP is transmitted for a short period of time.

foreSonetVtDiagnosticsLabel.name: foreSonetVtDiagnosticsLabel
foreSonetVtDiagnosticsLabel.description: Controls the transmission of generated label values to force PLM-V failures on the remote system. Value Description on(1) Use label value in foreSonetVtDiagnosticsLableValue off(2) Transmit label appropriate for VT type

foreSonetVtDiagnosticsLabelValue.name: foreSonetVtDiagnosticsLabelValue
foreSonetVtDiagnosticsLabelValue.description: Selects the label value to be transmitted in order to force PLM-V failures on the remote system.

foreSonetVtDiagnosticsREI.name: foreSonetVtDiagnosticsREI
foreSonetVtDiagnosticsREI.description: Controls the generation of VT REI on the selected interface. REI indicates to the far end that a BIP-2 error check failed. Value Description on(1) REI is continually tramsmitted off(2) REI is never transmitted auto(4) REI is transmitted according to the BIP-2

foreSonetLOSDetected.name: foreSonetLOSDetected
foreSonetLOSDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is experiencing Loss Of Signal. Bellcore Document TA-NWT-000253 Section 6.3.1.1.1 states that... A SONET NE shall declare a LOS failure when the LOS defect persists for 2.5 (+- .5) seconds, or when a LOS defect is present and the criteria for LOF failure declaration have been met.

foreSonetLOSCleared.name: foreSonetLOSCleared
foreSonetLOSCleared.description: This trap indicates that the LOS condition identified by trap foreSonetLOSDetected has been cleared.

foreSonetPathLabelDetected.name: foreSonetPathLabelDetected
foreSonetPathLabelDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is receiving and errored C2 Path Label byte. Reference Bellcore Document TA-NWT-000253 Section 3.3.2.3 and 6.3.1.1.8 the Path Label (C2) byte should have the value 0x13 or 0x01.

foreSonetPathLabelCleared.name: foreSonetPathLabelCleared
foreSonetPathLabelCleared.description: This trap indicates that the Errored Path Label (C2) byte error condition signaled by the foreSonetPathLabelDetected trap has been cleared.

foreSonetLineAISDetected.name: foreSonetLineAISDetected
foreSonetLineAISDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is receiving a Line level Alarm Indication Signal from the far-end equipment.

foreSonetLineAISCleared.name: foreSonetLineAISCleared
foreSonetLineAISCleared.description: This trap indicates that the Line AIS error condition signaled by the foreSonetLineAISDetected trap has been cleared.

foreSonetLOFDetected.name: foreSonetLOFDetected
foreSonetLOFDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is experiencing Loss Of Frame (LOF) failure. An LOF failure is declared when the LOF defect persists fore a period of 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds, except when an LOS defect or failure is present.

foreSonetLOFCleared.name: foreSonetLOFCleared
foreSonetLOFCleared.description: This trap indicates that the LOF failure identified by trap foreSonetLOFDetected has been cleared. The LOF failure is cleared when the LOS failure is declared, or when the LOF defect is absent for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetLineRDIDetected.name: foreSonetLineRDIDetected
foreSonetLineRDIDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is experiencing Line Remote Defect Indication (LRDI). A Line RDI failure is declared when the incoming Line RDI defects lasts for 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetLineRDICleared.name: foreSonetLineRDICleared
foreSonetLineRDICleared.description: This trap indicates that the Line RDI failure identified by trap foreSonetLineRDIDetected has been cleared. The Line RDI failure is cleared when no Line RDI defects are detected for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetPathAISDetected.name: foreSonetPathAISDetected
foreSonetPathAISDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is experiencing Path Alarm Inidication Signal (PAIS). A Path AIS failure is declared when the Path AIS defect persists for 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetPathAISCleared.name: foreSonetPathAISCleared
foreSonetPathAISCleared.description: This trap indicates that the PathAIS failure identified by trap foreSonetPathAISDetected has been cleared. A PAIS failure is cleared when the PAIS defect is absent for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetPathLOPDetected.name: foreSonetPathLOPDetected
foreSonetPathLOPDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is experiencing Loss Of Pointer (LOP). A LOP failure is declared when the LOP defect persists for a period of 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetPathLOPCleared.name: foreSonetPathLOPCleared
foreSonetPathLOPCleared.description: This trap indicates that the LOP failure identified by trap foreSonetLOPDetected has been cleared. A LOP failure is cleared when the LOP defect is absent for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetPathUNEQDetected.name: foreSonetPathUNEQDetected
foreSonetPathUNEQDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is experiencing unequiped (UNEQ). A UNEQ failure is declared when the UNEQ defect persists for a period of 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetPathUNEQCleared.name: foreSonetPathUNEQCleared
foreSonetPathUNEQCleared.description: This trap indicates that the UNEQ failure identified by trap foreSonetUNEQDetected has been cleared. A UNEQ failure is cleared when the UNEQ defect is absent for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetPathRDIDetected.name: foreSonetPathRDIDetected
foreSonetPathRDIDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is experiencing Path Remote Defect Indication (PRDI). A Path RDI failure is declared when the incoming Path RDI defects lasts for 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetPathRDICleared.name: foreSonetPathRDICleared
foreSonetPathRDICleared.description: This trap indicates that the Path RDI failure identified by trap foreSonetPathRDIDetected has been cleared. The Path RDI failure is cleared when no Path RDI defects are detected for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetPathPDIDetected.name: foreSonetPathPDIDetected
foreSonetPathPDIDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET path is experiencing a PDI-P ( Path Defect Indication) condition. A PDI-P indication is signalled by a value in the C2 ( path label ) byte in the range 0xe0..0xfc.

foreSonetPathPDICleared.name: foreSonetPathPDICleared
foreSonetPathPDICleared.description: This trap indicates that the PDI falure identified by trap foreSonetPathPDIDetected has been cleared.

foreSonetLineBIPDetected.name: foreSonetLineBIPDetected
foreSonetLineBIPDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified SONET port is experiencing Bit Interleaved Parity (BIP) errors. A Line BIP failure is declared when the Line BIP defect persists for a period of 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetLineBIPCleared.name: foreSonetLineBIPCleared
foreSonetLineBIPCleared.description: This trap indicates that the Line BIP failure identified by trap asxSonetAtmLineBIPDetected has been cleared. A Line BIP failure is cleared when the Line BIP defect is absent for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetVtAISDetected.name: foreSonetVtAISDetected
foreSonetVtAISDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified Sonet virtual tributary is receiving an AIS indication from the far end. An AIS-V failure is declared when the AIS-V defect persists for 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetVtAISCleared.name: foreSonetVtAISCleared
foreSonetVtAISCleared.description: This trap indicates that the virtual tributary AIS failure condition has been cleared. An AIS-V failure is cleared when the AIS-V defect is absent for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetVtLOPDetected.name: foreSonetVtLOPDetected
foreSonetVtLOPDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified virtual tributary is receiving an LOP-V failure. An LOP-V failure is declared when an LOP-V defect persists for 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetVtLOPCleared.name: foreSonetVtLOPCleared
foreSonetVtLOPCleared.description: This trap indicates that the specified virtual tributary is no longer experiencing loss-of-pointer failure. An LOP-V failure is cleared when the LOP-V defect is absent for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds

foreSonetVtUNEQDetected.name: foreSonetVtUNEQDetected
foreSonetVtUNEQDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified virtual tributary is receiving an UNEQ virtual tributary. (V5 byte is 0 ).

foreSonetVtUNEQCleared.name: foreSonetVtUNEQCleared
foreSonetVtUNEQCleared.description: This trap indicates that the specified virtual tributary is no longer receving an UNEQ virtual tributary.

foreSonetVtVILMDetected.name: foreSonetVtVILMDetected
foreSonetVtVILMDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified virtual tributary is experiencing a VT path label mismatch failure, PLM-V.

foreSonetVtVILMCleared.name: foreSonetVtVILMCleared
foreSonetVtVILMCleared.description: This trap indicates that the specified virtual tributary is no longer experiencing a PLM-V failure.

foreSonetVtRDIDetected.name: foreSonetVtRDIDetected
foreSonetVtRDIDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified virtual tributary is experiencing an RDI failure. An RDI-V failure is declared after the interface receives RDI-V defects for 2.5 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetVtRDICleared.name: foreSonetVtRDICleared
foreSonetVtRDICleared.description: This trap indicates that the specified virtual tributary is no longer experiencing an RDI failure. An RDI-V failure is cleared after the interface receives no RDI-V defects for 10 +/- 0.5 seconds.

foreSonetVtRFIDetected.name: foreSonetVtRFIDetected
foreSonetVtRFIDetected.description: This trap indicates that the specified virtual tributary is experiencing an RFI-V failure. An RFI-V failure is declared within 5 milliseconds of the detection of an incoming RFI-V indication.

foreSonetVtRFICleared.name: foreSonetVtRFICleared
foreSonetVtRFICleared.description: This trap indicates that the specified virtual tributary is no longer experiencing an RFI-V failure. An RFI-V failure is cleared within 50 milliseconds of the removal of an incoming RFI-V indication.

comments: Produced by pysmi-0.3.4 at Tue Apr 20 20:03:58 2021
